text:
‚ùóYou must stay home üò∑üè°  until:

1. 14 days have passed since your last close contact and

2. You have a negative COVID-19 test result, collected after your symptoms started.
You should still stay home while sick as much as you can, to prevent spread of other illnesses.

3. You get a doctor's note or clinic note that you do not need to isolate.

4. If you don't get tested or cleared by a healthcare provider, you must stay home until all of the following are true:
‚öà 10 days have passed since your symptoms started and
‚öà You haven't had a fever in the last 24 hours, without taking medicine for fever, and
‚öà Your symptoms are getting better.

richContent.text: What to do when you must stay home to prevent the spread of COVID-19
